intro: Convallaria verticillata, commonly known as the clustered lily-of-the-valley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features a rhizomatous root system and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers in early spring. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic and can be used in herbal remedies. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is known for its fragrant, sweet scent.
